message.content: This question requires knowledge about the conditions necessary for a fire to start and spread. A dry bush can burst into flames due to higher temperatures. Option (B) is incorrect because wetter air would also make the bush wet and less likely to catch fire. Option (D) is unrelated to the conditions for a fire and does not affect the likelihood of a dry bush bursting into flames.
